intro: Tricalysia anomalura, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. Tricalysia anomalura thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
